docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, June 30 -- Figures for trade with Latin America, which have been withheld since Pearl Harbor, were issued today by Secretary of Commerce Jesse H. Jones, showing for 1943 exports of $819,000,000 and a record total of imports of...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, June 30 -- Figures for trade with Latin America, which have been withheld since Pearl Harbor, were issued today by Secretary of Commerce Jesse H. Jones, showing for 1943 exports of $819,000,000 and a record total of imports of $1,310,000,000.
docs.abstract: Revised security regulations on statistics release cited

headline.main: AMERICAS' TRADE SET RECORD IN 1943; U.S. Imports $1,310,000,000, 34% Over '42, With Exports $819,000,000 for 14% Rise

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 1 -- The Argentine Government has accepted the challenge represented by the United States State Department's publication of the lecture delivered on June 10 by the Minister of War, Col. Juan Domingo Peron, at the University...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 1 -- The Argentine Government has accepted the challenge represented by the United States State Department's publication of the lecture delivered on June 10 by the Minister of War, Col. Juan Domingo Peron, at the University of La Plata and has replied to it by trying to arouse a wave of anti-United States sentiment among the Argentines.

headline.main: ARGENTINA BACKING ANTI-U.S. ATTITUDE; Hostile Comment Ordered on State Department's Digest of War Minister's Talk

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 29 (Delayed) -- The recall of the British Ambassador, Sir David Victor Kelly, from Buenos Aires came just two days after the whole pro-Government segment of the Argentine press had announced under prominent headlines that...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, June 29 (Delayed) -- The recall of the British Ambassador, Sir David Victor Kelly, from Buenos Aires came just two days after the whole pro-Government segment of the Argentine press had announced under prominent headlines that the British Foreign Office had decided not to follow the State Department's example and would leave him at his post.

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES
By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 7 -- The Argentine War Minister Col. Juan Domingo Peron, whose rash statements in a recent lecture about military preparedness at the University of La Plata aggravated the present crisis in relations with the United States,...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 7 -- The Argentine War Minister Col. Juan Domingo Peron, whose rash statements in a recent lecture about military preparedness at the University of La Plata aggravated the present crisis in relations with the United States, was appointed Vice President to fill the post vacated by Gen. Edelmiro Farrell when he assumed the Presidency last March.
docs.abstract: Peron apptd VP; Min Teisaire apptd Interior Min; tension with US eased; Farrell stresses sovereignty, Buenos Aires s

headline.main: ARGENTINA BOOSTS POWERS OF PERON; War Minister Is Named Vice President Soon After Rival Leaves Farrell Cabinet TENSION WITH U.S. EASES Perlinger's Resignation Takes Most Anti-Allied Executive Out of Prominent Post

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 8 -- The British Ambassador to Argentina, Sir David Victor Kelly, accompanied by his wife and son, left Buenos Aires by plane this morning for Santiago, Chile, en route to Washington and England after having been recalled to...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 8 -- The British Ambassador to Argentina, Sir David Victor Kelly, accompanied by his wife and son, left Buenos Aires by plane this morning for Santiago, Chile, en route to Washington and England after having been recalled to London for consultation.
docs.abstract: many Perlinger followers resign govt posts

headline.main: BRITISH DIPLOMAT LEAVES ARGENTINA; Ambassador Kelly and Family Will Fly to U.S. First -- Mrs. Armour Also on Plane

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 10 -- A fresh instance of the nationalist folly that at present is sweeping over Argentina is provided by a decree of the Federal Commissioner of the Province of Entre Rios. He has ordered that every town of any importance...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, July 10 -- A fresh instance of the nationalist folly that at present is sweeping over Argentina is provided by a decree of the Federal Commissioner of the Province of Entre Rios. He has ordered that every town of any importance in the territory under his jurisdiction shall immediately give the name "Sovereignty" to one of its principal streets.

headline.main: ARGENTINA ORDERS NEW ANTI-U.S. 'DIG'; Province Requires That Main Street in Each Town Bear Name of 'Sovereignty'

byline.original: By Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: It is only an hour's flight by air or an overnight trip by boat from Buenos Aires to Montevideo, but a gulf much wider than that through which flows the Rio de la Plata separates the capitals of Argentina and Uruguay.
docs.lead_paragraph: It is only an hour's flight by air or an overnight trip by boat from Buenos Aires to Montevideo, but a gulf much wider than that through which flows the Rio de la Plata separates the capitals of Argentina and Uruguay.

headline.main: URUGUAYANS ENJOY FULL DEMOCRACY; Smallest South American Land Puts No Curbs on Political Parties or Discussion

docs.snippet: BRETTON WOODS, N.H., July 15 -- After more than a week's delay the table of quotas (subscriptions) to the proposed international monetary fund was adopted today by the United Nations Monetary and Financial Conference. The aggregate was increased to...
docs.lead_paragraph: BRETTON WOODS, N.H., July 15 -- After more than a week's delay the table of quotas (subscriptions) to the proposed international monetary fund was adopted today by the United Nations Monetary and Financial Conference. The aggregate was increased to $8,800,000,000, compared to the original $8,000,000,000 and a subsequent proposal of $8,500,000,000.
docs.abstract: conf approves fund total increase to $8,800,000,000, quotas (subscriptions), gold payments, exec com of 12 including 2 from Latin Amer, voting system and flexible provision to project scarce currencies; rejects war-damaged nations cold concessions; quota compromises by USSR, France, India, China and Mex noted; table; balance of voting power discussed; Morgenthau expects US Cong approval of Internatl Monetary Fund

headline.main: CONFERENCE VOTES MONEY FUND QUOTAS; First Proposal of $8,000,000,000 Is Raised $800,000,000, Russia Getting Bigger Share GOLD AGREEMENT REACHED Soviet Is Voted Down on Demand That Payments of War-Torn Nations Be Cut

byline.original: By RUSSELL PORTERSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 17 (AP) -- Reports in Latin-American capitals that the United States and Britain were preparing to appease Argentina were denounced today by Secretary of State Cordell Hull as deliberately false.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 17 (AP) -- Reports in Latin-American capitals that the United States and Britain were preparing to appease Argentina were denounced today by Secretary of State Cordell Hull as deliberately false.
docs.abstract: Conf with Sec Hull on Argentine situation

headline.main: HULL DENIES STORY WE ABET ARGENTINA; Calls Latin-American Report Deliberately False -- Says Policy Is Clear to All
